title: Special maps-to operations
content: The following theorems are about maps-to operations (see ~ df-mpo ) where the domain of the second argument depends on the domain of the first argument, especially when the first argument is a pair and the base set of the second argument is the first component of the first argument, in short "x-maps-to operations". For labels, the abbreviations "mpt2x" are used (since "x" usually denotes the first argument). This is in line with the currently used conventions for such cases (see ~ cbvmpt2x , ~ ovmpt2x and ~ fmpt2x ). However, we are in the process of renaming to use the abbreviation "mpo" instead of "mpt2" (see ~ conventions-labels ). As this proposal is realized, the labels in the following should also be adapted. If the first argument is an ordered pair, as in the following, the abbreviation is extended to "mpt2xop", and the maps-to operations are called "x-op maps-to operations" for short.

blocks.name: opeliunxp2f
blocks.content: Membership in a union of Cartesian products, using bound-variable hypothesis for ` E ` instead of distinct variable conditions as in ~ opeliunxp2 . (Contributed by AV, 25-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm opeliunxp2f(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wb(wcel(cop(c0, c1), ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c4)))
  -| wnfc(s0, c4)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(c3, c4))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wcel(cop(c0, c1), ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c4)), wcel(c0, universe))
  sylbir(wcel(cop(c0, c1), ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))), wcel(c0, universe), wbr(c0, ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3)), c1))
  df-br(c0, ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3)), c1)
  brrelex1i(c0, ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3)), c1)
  mpbir(wrel(ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))), wral(s0, c2, wrel(cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))))
  rgenw(s0, c2, wrel(cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3)))
  relxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3)
  reliun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c4), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, c2)
  vtoclg1f(s0, c0, universe, wb(wcel(cop(c0, c1), ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c4))), wb(wcel(cop(cv(s0), c1), ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(c1, c3))))
  nfbi(s0, wcel(cop(c0, c1), ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c4)))
  nfel2(s0, cop(c0, c1), ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3)))
  nfiu1(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))
  nfan(s0, wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c4))
  nfv(s0, wcel(c0, c2))
  nfel2(s0, c1, c4)
  bibi12d(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cop(cv(s0), c1), ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(c1, c3)), wcel(cop(c0, c1), ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3))), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c4)))
  eleq1d(cop(cv(s0), c1), ciun(s0, c2, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c3)), cop(c0, c1), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  opeq1(cv(s0), c0, c1)
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c1, c4))
  eleq1(cv(s0), c0, c2)
  eleq2d(c1, c3, c4, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  opeliunxp(s0, c1, c2, c3)
  diff.cop.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c2)
}

blocks.name: mpt2xeldm
blocks.content: If there is an element of the value of an operation given by a maps-to rule, then the first argument is an element of the first component of the domain and the second argument is an element of the second component of the domain depending on the first argument. (Contributed by AV, 25-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm mpt2xeldm(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c1, c4), wcel(c3, csb(s0, c1, c5))))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, c4, c5, c6))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
} = {
  sylib(wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c1, c4), wcel(c3, csb(s0, c1, c5))), wcel(cop(c1, c3), ciun(s0, c4, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c5))))
  sseldi(cop(c1, c3), ciun(s0, c4, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), c5)), cdm(c2), wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)))
  dmmpt2ssx(s0, s1, c2, c4, c5, c6)
  eleq2s(c0, co(c1, c2, c3), cfv(c2, cop(c1, c3)), wcel(cop(c1, c3), cdm(c2)))
  elfvdm(c0, c2, cop(c1, c3))
  df-ov(c1, c2, c3)
  opeliunxp2f(s0, c1, c3, c4, c5, csb(s0, c1, c5))
  nfcsb1v(s0, c1, c5)
  csbeq1a(s0, c1, c5)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mpt2xeldm(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  âŠ¢ (c0 âˆˆ(c1[c2]c3)â†’(c1 âˆˆ c4 âˆ§ c3 âˆˆ[c1 / s0]c5))
  âŠ£ c2 =(s0 âˆˆ c4, s1 âˆˆ c5 â†¦ c6)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c3)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c4)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c4)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c5)
} = {
  sylib(c0 âˆˆ(c1[c2]c3), (c1 âˆˆ c4 âˆ§ c3 âˆˆ[c1 / s0]c5), < c1, c3 > âˆˆ â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c4,({ s0 } Ã— c5)))
  sseldi(< c1, c3 >, â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c4,({ s0 } Ã— c5)), dom(c2), c0 âˆˆ(c1[c2]c3))
  dmmpt2ssx(s0, s1, c2, c4, c5, c6)
  eleq2s(c0, (c1[c2]c3), (c2 ` < c1, c3 >), < c1, c3 > âˆˆ dom(c2))
  elfvdm(c0, c2, < c1, c3 >)
  df-ov(c1, c2, c3)
  opeliunxp2f(s0, c1, c3, c4, c5, [c1 / s0]c5)
  nfcsb1v(s0, c1, c5)
  csbeq1a(s0, c1, c5)
}

blocks.name: mpt2xneldm
blocks.content: If the first argument of an operation given by a maps-to rule is not an element of the first component of the domain or the second argument is not an element of the second component of the domain depending on the first argument, then the value of the operation is the empty set. (Contributed by AV, 25-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm mpt2xneldm(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wo(wnel(c0, c1), wnel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3))), wceq(co(c0, c4, c2), emptycls))
  -| wceq(c4, cmpo(s0, s1, c1, c3, c5))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  sylbi(wo(wnel(c0, c1), wnel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3))), wceq(co(c0, c4, c2), emptycls), wn(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3)))))
  bitr4i(wo(wnel(c0, c1), wnel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3))), wn(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3)))), wo(wn(wcel(c0, c1)), wn(wcel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3)))))
  orbi12i(wnel(c0, c1), wnel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3)), wn(wcel(c0, c1)), wn(wcel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3))))
  df-nel(c0, c1)
  df-nel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3))
  ianor(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3)))
  con1i(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3))), wceq(co(c0, c4, c2), emptycls))
  sylbi(wn(wceq(co(c0, c4, c2), emptycls)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3))), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, c4, c2))))
  neq0(hs0, co(c0, c4, c2))
  exlimiv(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, c4, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3))))
  mpt2xeldm(s0, s1, cv(hs0), c0, c4, c2, c1, c3, c5)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, c4, c2))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, csb(s0, c0, c3))))
}

thm mpt2xneldm(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

  âŠ£ c4 =(s0 âˆˆ c1, s1 âˆˆ c3 â†¦ c5)

blocks.name: mpt2xopn0yelv
blocks.content: If there is an element of the value of an operation given by a maps-to rule, where the first argument is a pair and the base set of the second argument is the first component of the first argument, then the second argument is an element of the first component of the first argument. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Oct-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm mpt2xopn0yelv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wi(wcel(c4, co(cop(c0, c2), c5, c6)), wcel(c6, c0)))
  -| wceq(c5, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, cfv(c1st, cv(s0)), c7))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
} = {
  syl5ib(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c4, co(cop(c0, c2), c5, c6)), wcel(c6, c0), wcel(c6, cfv(c1st, cop(c0, c2))))
  syl(wcel(c4, co(cop(c0, c2), c5, c6)), wcel(c6, cfv(c1st, cop(c0, c2))), wcel(cop(cop(c0, c2), c6), ciun(s0, universe, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cfv(c1st, cv(s0))))))
  sseldi(cop(cop(c0, c2), c6), ciun(s0, universe, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cfv(c1st, cv(s0)))), cdm(c5), wcel(c4, co(cop(c0, c2), c5, c6)))
  dmmpt2ssx(s0, s1, c5, universe, cfv(c1st, cv(s0)), c7)
  eleq2s(c4, co(cop(c0, c2), c5, c6), cfv(c5, cop(cop(c0, c2), c6)), wcel(cop(cop(c0, c2), c6), cdm(c5)))
  elfvdm(c4, c5, cop(cop(c0, c2), c6))
  df-ov(cop(c0, c2), c5, c6)
  simprbi(wcel(cop(cop(c0, c2), c6), ciun(s0, universe, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cfv(c1st, cv(s0))))), wcel(c6, cfv(c1st, cop(c0, c2))), wcel(cop(c0, c2), universe))
  opeliunxp2(s0, cop(c0, c2), c6, universe, cfv(c1st, cv(s0)), cfv(c1st, cop(c0, c2)))
  fveq2(cv(s0), cop(c0, c2), c1st)
  eleq2d(c6, cfv(c1st, cop(c0, c2)), c0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  op1stg(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c1st, cv(s0))
  diff.c1st.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1st, cop(c0, c2))
  diff.c1st.s(s0)
  diff.cop.s(s0, c0, c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mpt2xopn0yelv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  âŠ¢ ((c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ c3)â†’(c4 âˆˆ(< c0, c2 >[c5]c6)â†’ c6 âˆˆ c0))
  âŠ£ c5 =(s0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, s1 âˆˆ(1st ` s0)â†¦ c7)

  syl(c4 âˆˆ(< c0, c2 >[c5]c6), c6 âˆˆ(1st ` < c0, c2 >), < < c0, c2 >, c6 > âˆˆ â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ,({ s0 } Ã—(1st ` s0))))
  sseldi(< < c0, c2 >, c6 >, â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ,({ s0 } Ã—(1st ` s0))), dom(c5), c4 âˆˆ(< c0, c2 >[c5]c6))
  dmmpt2ssx(s0, s1, c5, universe, (1st ` s0), c7)
  eleq2s(c4, (< c0, c2 >[c5]c6), (c5 ` < < c0, c2 >, c6 >), < < c0, c2 >, c6 > âˆˆ dom(c5))
  elfvdm(c4, c5, < < c0, c2 >, c6 >)
  df-ov(< c0, c2 >, c5, c6)
  simprbi(< < c0, c2 >, c6 > âˆˆ â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ,({ s0 } Ã—(1st ` s0))), c6 âˆˆ(1st ` < c0, c2 >), < c0, c2 > âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  opeliunxp2(s0, < c0, c2 >, c6, universe, (1st ` s0), (1st ` < c0, c2 >))
  fveq2(s0, < c0, c2 >, c1st)
  eleq2d(c6, (1st ` < c0, c2 >), c0, (c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ c3))
  op1stg(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c1st, s0)
  diff.c1st.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1st, < c0, c2 >)
  diff.c1st.s(s0)
  diff.cop.s(s0, c0, c2)
